title: Larry Cox and Julio Torres

title: People's Resurrection March
abstract: Photograph from the People's Resurrection March led by Daniel Ismael Aguilar (pictured here with megaphone). This was part of the Holy Week of Resistance movement: http://www.holyweekofresistance.net/vision/

title: Call for a Poor People's Campaign for Today Organizing Pamphlet
name_primary: Kairos Center, designed by Colleen Wessel-McCoy
abstract: Booklet outlining call for and possibility of a new Poor People's Campaign for Today created by the Kairos Center for Religions, Rights and Social Justice together with other community leaders and organizations.

title: Praying for the end of the eviction of Hurricane Katrina survivors
abstract: The Kairos Center and leaders from Safe Harbor, a housing development built for Katrina survivors, pray together with a delegation from the Poor People’s Campaign from across the US. They were delivering a letter to city hall demanding an end to evictions after rents at Safe Harbor were tripled. Photo by Jose Vasquez.

title: Union staff and alumni learn how devastation continues years after the BP oil spill
abstract: Union's Poverty Scholar in Residence Willie Baptist (center right) listens as Vietnam veteran and oysterman Byron Encalade (center) and two fisherman in Point A’La Hache, Louisiana describe how their livelihoods have been devastated by the BP oil spill during a fact finding delegation to the Gulf coast as part of the call for a new Poor People's Campaign. Photo by Jose Vasquez.

title: House band at the launch of the Kairos Center
abstract: House band of Union alumni, staff and community leaders in James Chapel at the launch of the Kairos Center for Religions, Rights and Social Justice. Photo by Jose Vasquez.

title: Rev. Dr. William Barber, II at Kairos Center Launch
abstract: NC NAACP's Rev. Dr. William Barber, II delivers keynote sermon in James Chapel at the launch of the Kairos Center for Religions, Rights and Social Justice. Photo by Jose Vasquez.

title: Moral Day of Action in Albany, NY
abstract: The Kairos Center for Religions, Rights, and Social Justice and Poverty Initiative at Union Theological Seminary traveled with students, alumni, staff and community and religious leaders (including Picture the Homeless) to the Moral Day of Action at the New York State Capitol in conjunction with the Moral Week of Action in the South and Beyond spearheaded by the Forward Together and Moral Mondays Movement and the North Carolina NAACP.

title: Kairos Center Directors Arrested with Walmart Workers Outside Alice Walton's Mansion
abstract: Union's Kairos Center Co-directors Larry Cox and Rev. Dr. Liz Theoharis block traffic just before arrest in the OUR-Walmart action for fair wages and hours outside Alice Walton's New York mansion.

title: Kairos Center participants in the 2014 Climate March
abstract: Students, staff and children from Union's Kairos Center join the Climate March alongside President Serene Jones.
note_filename: Religions for the Earth March Sept 2014.jpg

title: Kairos Center's Rev. Dr. Liz Theoharis (2004, 2014) and her son Luke at the 2015 Moral March in Raleigh, NC
abstract: Kairos Center Co-director Rev. Dr. Liz Theoharis, course instructor of the 2015 January immersion course traveling to Raleigh, NC to learn from the NC NAACP and the Historic Thousands on Jones Street March. This was the Poverty Initiative's thirteenth immersion course.

title: Kairos Center delegation in the 2015 Moral March in Raleigh, NC
abstract: Delegation of 60 students, alumni, community and religious leaders traveling with the Kairos Center's January immersion course (CS205) to the Historic Thousands on Jones Street March in Raleigh, NC.

title: Union Children in the Moral March in Raleigh, NC
abstract: Children of Union students and alumni take part in the Historic Thousands on Jones Street March in Raleigh, NC, traveling with 60 students and community leaders as part of the delegation from Union's Kairos Center for Religions, Rights and Social Justice and it's Poverty Initiative.

title: Program, Community Hearing on Poverty: A Renewal of Rev. Dr. King's Poor People's Campaign
name_primary: Kairos Center at UTS and Colleen Wessel-McCoy
abstract:
Program from the Community Hearing on Poverty during the 50th anniversary of the Edmund Pettus Bridge crossing in Selma, Alabama, convened by the Kairos Center for Religions Rights and Social Justice at Union Theological Seminary.

(Also available as sequential pages rather than booklet print.)

title: Collective Speech Before Moving
abstract: One of the protest organizers prepared the group in Union Square to move by having us repeat the message he gave us in short phrases so that everyone could hear.  It was a tactic used in many demonstrations so that everyone could hear and was also listening.

title: UTS @ Moral March
abstract: Kairos Center and Poverty Initiative ran a class, CS 205, and we went to Raleigh, North Carolina to march with the Moral Movement. This is run by the NAACP and coordinated by Rev. Dr. William Barber. This was a great saturday morning with a few students holding the banner. Some took the class for credits, others just for the experience and to show solidarity and be activists
